::Shuttle/Fractyl::

The Alliance shuttle detects VorbIss entering and the hatch begins to close once VorbIss is inside, although there was another bot stumbling out into the clearing.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., Robin Kirkman <robin@d...> wrote:
> On Thursday 23 August 2001 00:48, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > Looking around, Fractyl sees nothing of particular interest, but his
> > scanners detect a bot and a shuttle south of here. Stumbling slightly, he
> > makes his way south. The bot wasn't too far.
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > The shuttle slows down as it approaches where VorbIss was, lowering in
> > altitude and landing. A hatch opens as it scans for VorbIss.
> 
> ::VorbIss::
> 
> [The shuttle is here.] projected Iss, startling Vorb out of a small nap. 
> After mounting his left-arm taser (and an argon cutting laser kept secret as 
> a backup by Iss), VorbIss had definately been tired. Waiting for the shuttle 
> to approach had been a welcome opportunity for rest, but now it was time to 
> meet some potential allies.
> 
> VorbIss jumped out of the tree and transformed to robot mode. With the 
> modifications to his left arm in beast mode, his left arm now looked slightly 
> disfigured. "I'm going to have to work on my transformations. This left arm 
> didn't take the taser mounting well." thought Vorb to himself, forgetting 
> about Iss for a second. [Indeed, you must work on your transformationa a 
> great deal.] replied Iss. [With practice and sufficient computing power, you 
> may learn to transform yourself without harm to other modes.] Iss noted to 
> himself VorbIss's right arm, which was looking and feeling entirely normal, 
> despite the laser hidden away in its mechanics.
> 
> "Hello, future. Heh. The Alliance. Not a great name, but it sounds like a 
> decently strong faction. I guess I'll knwo soon enough." VorbIss said aloud, 
> to nobody in particular, as he scanned the shuttle.
> 
> Seeing no danger, VorbIss walked over and into the shuttle. Surely some 
> automatic systems would respond to his presence.
